ru.yandex.subtitles.ui.adapter

Class AbstractRecyclerViewAdapter<E,VH extends AbstractViewHolder>

  • java.lang.Object
    • android.support.v7.widget.RecyclerView.Adapter<VH>
      • ru.yandex.subtitles.ui.adapter.AbstractRecyclerViewAdapter<E,VH>
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    AbstractViewHolder.OnViewHolderClickListener
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    AnswersAdapter, ConversationAdapter, ConversationsAdapter, QualityFeedbackAdapter, QuickResponsesAdapter, StartingPhrasesAdapter

    public abstract class AbstractRecyclerViewAdapter<E,VH extends AbstractViewHolder>
extends android.support.v7.widget.RecyclerView.Adapter<VH>
implements AbstractViewHolder.OnViewHolderClickListener
    Base adapter class that simplifies working with RecyclerView. Class provides ability to animate data changes, handle clicks on items.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static interface  AbstractRecyclerViewAdapter.OnItemClickListener<E>
      Interface definition for a callback to be invoked when an item in this AdapterView has been clicked.

      • getItems

        protected java.util.List<E> getItems()

      • setItems

        public void setItems(java.util.List<E> items)
        Set entities when new data is loaded. Notice that you should provide unique Object.hashCode() for every entity to make sure animation will be applied correctly. Object.equals(Object) should be overriden too.
        Parameters:
        items - a non-null List of entities.

      • remove

        public E remove(int position)
        Removes entity at a given position and animates removal.
        Parameters:
        position - an index in the list of entities.
        Returns:
        removed entity.

      • getItem

        public E getItem(int position)
        Get the data item associated with the specified position in the data set.
        Parameters:
        position - position of the item whose data we want within the adapter's data set.
        Returns:
        The data entity at the specified position.

      • areAllItemsEnabled

        public boolean areAllItemsEnabled()
        Indicates whether all the items in this adapter are enabled. If the value returned by this method changes over time, there is no guarantee it will take effect. If true, it means all items are selectable and clickable (there is no separator.)
        Returns:
        True if all items are enabled, false otherwise.
        See Also:
        isEnabled(int)

      • isEnabled

        public boolean isEnabled(int position)
        Returns true if the item at the specified position is clickable.

        The result is unspecified if position is invalid. An ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException should be thrown in that case for fast failure.

        Parameters:
        position - an index of the item
        Returns:
        true if item is clickable, false otherwise.
        See Also:
        areAllItemsEnabled()

      • getClickableViewIds

        public int[] getClickableViewIds(int position)
        Returns array of clickable views ids at a given position. Use AbstractViewHolder.DEFAULT_CLICKABLE_VIEW_ID to make root view clickable.
        Parameters:
        position - an index in the data set.
        Returns:
        an array of view ids. Use AbstractViewHolder.DEFAULT_CLICKABLE_VIEW_IDS if only root view should be clickable.
